vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/fd5cb368-4b51-44f6-970c-908acad4bf55">WAGES</keyword>         <topcClas>Consumer behaviour - Economics</topcClas>         <topcClas>Health services and medical care - Health</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>This project developed a test for asymmetric information in the UK private health insurance (PHI) market. In contrast to earlier research that considered either a purely private system or one where private insurance is complementary to public insurance, PHI is substitutive of the public system in the UK. Using a theoretical model of competition among insurers incorporating this characteristic, the project linked the type of selection (adverse or propitious) with the existence of risk-related information asymmetries. Using the <i>British Household Panel Survey</i> (BHPS) (held at the UK Data Archive under SN 5151), evidence was found that adverse selection is present in the PHI market, which led to the conclusion that such information asymmetries exist.<br> <br> Further information may be found in the journal article that uses these data: <br> Olivella, P. and Vera-Hernandez, M. (2012) 'Testing for asymmetric information in private health insurance', <i>Economic Journal</i>, retrieved September 3, 2012 from <a href="http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.1468-0297.2012.02520.x/full" title="'Testing for asymmetric information in private health insurance">http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.1468-0297.2012.02520.x/full</a> (may require subscription).<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The file includes a subset of data from Waves 6-18 of the BHPS (residents in England, Wales, and Scotland only), covering male employees aged 23-59. See documentation for further details.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="start" date="1996-01-01T00:00:00Z">1996</timePrd>         <timePrd event="end" date="2008-01-01T00:00:00Z">2008</timePrd>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Government Office Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Selected respondents to the BHPS: male employees aged 23-59 living in either England, Scotland, or Wales (Great Britain) in the period 1996-2008.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Longitudinal/panel/cohort</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>data were taken from BHPS Waves 6-18.</timeMeth>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>175,368 cases</deviat>         <collMode>Compilation or synthesis of existing material</collMode>         <collMode>The BHPS data were originally gathered by face-to-face interview.</collMode>         <sources>           <dataSrc>Data were taken from BHPS Waves 6-18, 1996-2008.</dataSrc>         </sources>         <weight>Refer to BHPS for weighting information.</weight>         <cleanOps>B</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply.
